workflowDef.name: Feature Full
workflowDef.description: Full feature delivery: scope to MVP, specialist pre-implementation review panel, adversarial post-implementation checks, and documentation

scope-review.description: MVP scoping gate â€” evaluate requirements for size, break down if too large, define the bounded increment and acceptance criteria before any planning begins

planning.description: Architecture planning and task breakdown â€” plan against the scoped increment defined by scope-review, not the full original request

architecture-review.description: Architecture and design review â€” SOLID principles, coupling, cohesion, API contracts, scalability

security-review.description: Pre-implementation security review â€” threat modeling, attack surface analysis, auth flows, data exposure risks

performance-review.description: Pre-implementation performance review â€” algorithmic complexity, DB query patterns, caching needs, bottleneck predictions

ux-review.description: UX design review â€” user flows, component specs, accessibility, design system adherence

devops-review.description: Operational readiness review â€” CI/CD, deployment strategy, secrets management, observability, migration safety

plan-approval.description: Final plan gate â€” synthesize all specialist feedback, challenge assumptions, approve or block

implementation.description: Code generation and implementation â€” implement only the scoped increment, all specialist review feedback must be addressed

red-team-assessment.description: Adversarial post-implementation review â€” attack the code, hunt edge cases, probe failure modes

performance-validation.description: Post-implementation performance validation â€” benchmark, profile, verify against pre-implementation predictions

verification.description: Final QA â€” run tests, check coverage, validate against acceptance criteria

commit.description: Stage changes and create a conventional commit

done.description: Increment complete â€” generate changelog entry, update docs, and note deferred increments

backlog-reconcile.description: Reconcile canonical backlog statuses after verification evidence. Mark completed in-sprint items done, keep partials in-progress/in-sprint with explicit residual notes.

currentStateTask: Finalize workflow completion for this sprint increment after commit `0475314`. Provide concise user-facing completion summary including: sprint goal achieved status, items completed (006/008/009), key deliverables, verification evidence highlights, commit reference, and note any deferred/non-blocking follow-ups (e.g., Storybook warning cleanup, dependency alignment).

history.summary: User requested to start sprint; initiating workflow planning for selected sprint scope (items 006/008/009).
history.taskGiven: Start sprint execution for the already-selected dependency-first sprint scope from canonical artifacts: `.pi/chronicle/sprint-plan.md` and `.pi/chronicle/backlog.json`. Treat this sprint MVP scope as exactly: `item-006`, `item-008`, `item-009` (6 points total) with goal to unblock `item-010 -> item-016 -> item-019`. Produce an implementation-ready plan for this scoped increment only, including task breakdown, sequencing (006 first, then 008/009 parallel), assumptions, and acceptance mapping. Do not expand scope beyond these three items. Identify any blockers that must be resolved before implementation begins.
history.outputPreview:

   - Explicitly exclude all other backlo

history.summary: Started sprint and completed implementation planning for scoped items 006/008/009; now running architecture gate before coding.
history.taskGiven: Pre-implementation architecture review for scoped sprint increment only: item-006 (React Vite TS scaffold + aliases + lint/format), item-008 (Storybook baseline Button stories), item-009 (Playwright smoke suite). Review planned structure for SOLID/cohesion/coupling/API contracts and long-term maintainability in a monorepo. Validate decisions: item-006 must complete first; 008 and 009 parallel after. Flag architectural risks (config duplication/drift across TS/Vite/Storybook/Playwright), propose concrete architecture guardrails and minimal file organization conventions to prevent rework in downstream item-010/016 chain.
history.outputPreview:
1. **Architecture Fit**  
Overall, the scoped plan (006 → then 008/009 in parallel) is a strong fit for this monorepo’s existing architecture and dependency graph.  
- `apps/web` already exists with Vite/TS, Storybook, and Playwright-oriented structure, matching locked decisions in backlog (`apps/`

history.summary: Architecture gate passed with notes; proceeding to security gate before implementation.
history.taskGiven: Pre-implementation security review for scoped sprint items only: item-006 (React/Vite/TS scaffold and tooling config), item-008 (Storybook baseline Button stories), item-009 (Playwright smoke test setup and artifacts). Assess threat model and attack surface for dev tooling, config, scripts, and test artifacts. Focus on risks like unsafe env handling, exposed secrets in Storybook/test configs, insecure defaults in dev server/test runner, and artifact leakage (traces/screenshots). Provide hardening recommendations that are minimally invasive and implementable in this sprint without scope creep.
history.outputPreview:

Provide measurable targets/thresholds appropriate for this scope and recommendations that avoid scope creep.

history.summary: Performance gate passed with measurable guardrails; proceeding to UX gate before implementation.

history.summary: UX gate passed with baseline accessibility guardrails; moving to DevOps gate before plan approval.
history.taskGiven: DevOps pre-implementation review for scoped sprint items 006/008/009. Evaluate operational readiness for local developer onboarding and near-term CI for frontend scaffold, Storybook baseline, and Playwright smoke. Focus on script contracts (root vs app), reproducibility/version pinning, caching opportunities, artifact handling, and migration safety toward downstream item-010 and item-016. Provide minimal but concrete recommendations we should enforce during this sprint without expanding scope.

  - Only one workflow exists: `.github/workflows/perf-budget-gate.yml` (no general PR CI gate visible yet for web lint/ty

history.summary: User chose to fix plan omissions and re-run approval. Routing back to planning to codify all specialist must-haves as explicit mandatory tasks/acceptance checks.
history.taskGiven:
Address plan-approval BLOCK by updating the implementation plan for scoped sprint items 006/008/009 with explicit must-fix tasks and acceptance checks derived from specialist reviews. Keep scope unchanged (006 first, then 008/009 parallel). Convert prior advisory notes into mandatory checklist items in plan output:

1) Architecture guardrails (mandatory):
- Define one canonical alias contract `@/* -> ./src/*` and explicitly propagate/verify across tsconfig, Vite, Storybook, and Playwright contexts.
- State root-script contract rule: future root scripts are wrappers over app scripts (no duplicated logic/divergent behavior).

2) Security hardening (mandatory in this sprint where applicable):
- Localhost-only binding for Vite/Storybook dev (`127.0.0.1`).
- Sanitize Storybook CI error logging (avoid raw error object in CI).
- Playwright artifact hygiene: ensure ignore rules + failure-focused artifact capture policy.

3) UX/a11y baseline (mandatory acceptance mapping):
- App shell includes semantic `main` and single meaningful `h1`.
- Button uses native button semantics, visible `:focus-visible`, proper disabled behavior.
- Playwright smoke uses role-based heading assertion.

4) Performance/DevOps guardrails (mandatory verification steps, not scope expansion):
- Add measurable runtime targets as plan verification thresholds for this increment (vite dev/build, storybook dev/build, smoke runtime).
- Explicitly avoid duplicate heavy CI work strategy and preserve wrapper-script compatibility for item-010/016.
- Include CI-aware Playwright settings guidance (conservative workers/retries/failure artifacts) as implementation constraints.

Deliver an updated implementation-ready plan with a concise “must-fix checklist satisfied” section and clear DoD checks so we can re-run plan-approval.
history.outputPreview:
1. **Confirm scoped sprint boundary and dependency order (lock plan inputs)**
   - Scope remains **exactly**: `item-006`, `item-008`, `item-009` (no additions).
   - Enforce sequencing: **006 first**, then **008 and 009 in parallel**.
   - Pre-check assumptions before implementation kickoff:
     -

history.summary: Addressed plan-approval block by updating planning output with explicit mandatory tasks/DoD checks for all specialist must-haves; requesting re-evaluation.
history.taskGiven:
Re-run final plan gate after corrections. Updated plan remains scoped to items 006/008/009 only and explicitly codifies prior specialist must-haves as mandatory implementation tasks and DoD checks. Please evaluate whether prior BLOCK omissions are now resolved.

Corrections incorporated:
- Architecture: canonical alias contract `@/* -> ./src/*` with explicit propagation verification across TS/Vite/Storybook/Playwright contexts; root-script wrapper contract explicitly mandatory.
- Security: localhost-only binding for Vite/Storybook (`127.0.0.1`), sanitized Storybook CI error logging, Playwright artifact ignore + failure-focused capture policy.
- UX: semantic `main` + single meaningful `h1`, native button semantics, visible `:focus-visible`, correct disabled behavior, role-based heading assertion in Playwright smoke.
- Performance/DevOps: measurable runtime thresholds as mandatory verification gates and explicit anti-duplicate heavy CI-work strategy while preserving wrapper compatibility for downstream 010/016.

Request verdict APPROVE/BLOCK and list any remaining must-fix items if blocked.
history.outputPreview:
### Summary

history.summary: Plan approved after corrections; starting implementation for items 006/008/009 with mandatory guardrails and DoD gates.
history.taskGiven:
Begin implementation for approved scoped sprint increment only: item-006, item-008, item-009. Enforce sequence: complete item-006 first and verify acceptance, then execute item-008 and item-009 in parallel.

Mandatory constraints from plan approval (must be implemented, not advisory):
- Canonical alias contract `@/* -> ./src/*` propagated/verified across TS, Vite, Storybook, and Playwright contexts.
- Root script contract preserved as wrappers over app scripts (no divergent duplicate logic).
- Localhost-only binding for Vite/Storybook (`127.0.0.1`).
- Storybook CI error logging sanitized.
- Playwright artifact hygiene: gitignore coverage + failure-focused capture policy.
- UX/a11y baseline: semantic `main` + single meaningful `h1`; Button native semantics + visible `:focus-visible` + proper disabled behavior.
- Playwright smoke uses role-based heading assertion.
- Capture/verify performance thresholds for this increment where practical.

Please implement with minimal scope, run validations mapped to acceptance criteria, and report files changed + command/test evidence + any residual risks.
history.outputPreview:
Implemented the scoped sprint increment for **item-006, item-008, item-009** with the required sequencing and guardrails.

history.summary: Implementation completed for 006/008/009 with mandatory guardrails; now running adversarial review.
history.taskGiven: Perform adversarial post-implementation review for scoped sprint changes (items 006/008/009). Focus on attack/failure modes in new frontend tooling setup: alias/config drift regressions, localhost binding bypasses, Storybook logging leakage, Playwright artifact leakage, brittle smoke assertions, and script contract inconsistencies between root and app. Try to break expected behavior with edge cases and identify any must-fix issues before performance-validation/verification.
history.outputPreview:

  - `apps/web/playwright.config.ts` (webServer command, artifact policy, reporter output)
- **Scr

history.summary: Red-team assessment identified a medium blocker (PORT validation) and a low optional CI hardening; routing back to implementation for fixes.
history.taskGiven: Address red-team findings with minimal scoped patch. Required fix: in `apps/web/vite.config.ts`, validate/clamp env `PORT` before assigning `server.port` so invalid values (NaN, <=0, >65535, malformed strings) safely fallback to 5173. Keep localhost-only binding and strictPort behavior intact. Optional recommended hardening: in `apps/web/.storybook/main.ts` catch path, fail hard in CI if alias import fails (while keeping sanitized logging). After patch, run relevant validation commands and report files changed and evidence.
history.outputPreview:
Implemented immediately with a minimal scoped patch for the red-team finding, plus the optional CI-hardening in Storybook.

## ✅ Files modified

1. `apps/web/vite.config.ts`
2. `apps/web/.storybook/main.ts`

---
